co.kruzr.bernoulli.desilting

Class Dam

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.kruzr.bernoulli.desilting.Dam

  • public class Dam
extends Object
    Model class for a dam which may have been constructed on a given stream, which is basically a metaphor for obstructions in the execution of a method.

    Encapsulates all the permissions and settings of the method (basically impediments in the flow of the stream) which need to be removed, and so will be asked from the user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dam(StreamFlowState streamFlowState)
      If streamFlowState is either StreamFlowState.FLOW or StreamFlowState.STAGNATE, then it means the method's state is clear - it should be executed in the former case and not executed in the latter case.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<RequiresPermission> getAskPermissions()
      Returns the list of permissions that need to be asked from the user.
      List<RequiresSetting> getShowSettingsRequirementDialog()
      Returns the list of settings whose state requirement needs to be shown to the user.
      void setAskPermissions(List<RequiresPermission> askPermissions)
      Sets the list of permissions that need to be asked from the user.
      void setShowSettingsRequirementDialog(List<RequiresSetting> showSettingsRequirementDialog)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dam

        public Dam(StreamFlowState streamFlowState)
        If streamFlowState is either StreamFlowState.FLOW or StreamFlowState.STAGNATE, then it means the method's state is clear - it should be executed in the former case and not executed in the latter case. In these cases, we want the askPermissions and askSettings lists to be empty and un-editable from outside of this class.

        So for those cases, we make them unmodifiable in the constructor itself.

        Parameters:
        streamFlowState -

    • Method Detail

      • getAskPermissions

        public List<RequiresPermission> getAskPermissions()
        Returns the list of permissions that need to be asked from the user.
        Returns:

      • setAskPermissions

        public void setAskPermissions(List<RequiresPermission> askPermissions)
        Sets the list of permissions that need to be asked from the user. The values are only updated if streamFlowState is StreamFlowState.CHOKED since in other states, the fate of the stream, i.e. method's execution, is clear.
        Parameters:
        askPermissions -

      • getShowSettingsRequirementDialog

        public List<RequiresSetting> getShowSettingsRequirementDialog()
        Returns the list of settings whose state requirement needs to be shown to the user.
        Returns:

      • setShowSettingsRequirementDialog

        public void setShowSettingsRequirementDialog(List<RequiresSetting> showSettingsRequirementDialog)
        Sets the list of settings whose states need to be shown to the user. The values are only updated if streamFlowState is StreamFlowState.CHOKED since in other states, the fate of the stream, i.e. method's execution, is clear.
        Parameters:
        showSettingsRequirementDialog -
